Key Match Events: Juan Soto hit a 402-foot home run in the sixth inning, giving the Yankees a 2-1 lead.
Salvador Perez tied the game with a sacrifice fly in the seventh inning.
The Yankees won 4-3 on an infield single by Jazz Chisholm in the bottom of the 11th inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Jazz Chisholm commented on the intense environment, saying it felt like a playoff game.
Chisholm expressed excitement for the upcoming series against the Boston Red Sox.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Juan Soto suffered a midgame injury scare but continued to play and hit a home run.
The Yankees extended their lead to 1 1/2 games in the American League East.
